definition: to ride the wind/to use a fair wind/to take an opportunity
four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions

sentences.english: The captain ordered the crew to square away and sail before the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船长命令水手迎风扬帆，乘风行驶。

sentences.english: The whaling fleet began to fill away on a northerly course.
sentences.chinese: 捕鲸船队开始向北乘风前进。

sentences.english: Timmerman showed him how it was built to sail against the wind and turn into the waves.
sentences.chinese: 提莫曼给他说明了如何造船才能乘风破浪而行。

sentences.english: Chengfeng brand heat exchangers and fasteners won the title as famous AAproducts.
sentences.chinese: 乘风牌换热器，美力达风机为AA省名牌产品。

sentences.english: The ship of China-US relations, moored for so long, again set sail, braving the wind and waves.
sentences.chinese: 停航许久的中美关系大船又乘风破浪启航了。

sentences.english: The ship buffeted her way through the waves.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船乘风破浪地前进。

sentences.english: As the "Bonadventure" no longer existed, six months at least would be required for the construction of a new vessel.
sentences.chinese: 乘风破浪号已经没有了，造一只新船至少要六个月。

sentences.english: Then wind arose, and the little sailing boat filled away.
sentences.chinese: 接着乱起了一阵风，于是小帆船乘风而去。

sentences.english: Vapours from other continent arrived upon the wind .
sentences.chinese: 远洲异国的水汽，乘风来到这里。

sentences.english: South China City Center Building, like a sail, a symbol of the winds and waves of the helmsman.
sentences.chinese: 华南城中心大厦，像个船帆，象征着乘风破浪的舵手。

sentences.english: We sailed ahead of the wind , the island moving past quickly .
sentences.chinese: 我们乘风航行，岛上的景物迅速向后退去。

sentences.english: The poet wind is out over the sea and the forest to seek his own vice.
sentences.chinese: 诗人乘风，正出经海洋森林，追求它自己的歌声。

sentences.english: He finds it exciting to ride a motorboat through the sea waves.
sentences.chinese: 驾着摩托艇在海上乘风破浪的感觉，让他觉得很刺激。

sentences.english: Claimants cords of two ponds, brave the wind and sail pocket, but also have taken drift had drowned.
sentences.chinese: 绳系舶两傍，乘风扬帆而兜取之，然亦有漂溺之患。

sentences.english: Singaporeans have ridden the wave of increasing wealth throughout Asia.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的经济在亚洲财富快速增长的浪潮中乘风破浪。

sentences.english: Can we go wind- surfing here?

definition: to set sail/to brave the waves
to promote (to official position in former times)
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
(literary) the vast sky/(finance) eventual downturn/poor prospects in the long term
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
Blue Dragon, other name of the Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙 (the seven mansions of the east sky)
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
Lingyun county in Baise 百色[Bai3 se4], Guangxi
